column4: hello everybody , will anybody tell me how to run a program using k develop
shift+F9
it is a simple program to find out sum of two numbers
ok thank u
it is not working
what's it say? your code probably has bugs in it.
give me step by step guide i am new to linux and very new to programming
what should be file name extension

step 1: open kdevelop, step 2: open a project, or start a new one, step 3: write your code (there are awesome tutorials out there to teach you basic syntax), step 4: compile (F8) step 5: Run the program
there aren't filename extentions for binaries in linux.
it'll be like... /path/to/your/project/bin/projectname

if you're used to windows, nothing will make sense at first... then you'll have more and more "aha!" moments, seeing how logical everything in linux is... eventually you realize how much windows totally doesn't make any sense at all :-P
That's generally the learning curve...
i write and saved the program and press f8 to compile it but nothing happens
once it's compiled, if there were no errors, then there is now a binary in the folder you're working out of...
run that
i press shift+f9 and nothing happened again
then you're code doesn't work, there are some awesome online tutorials on how to program, check them out.
